{{knowledge objective

|Item_parent=Discomfort, loss of consciousness, coma in adults (see item 105)
|Item_parent_short=Discomfort, loss of consciousness, coma in adults (see item 105)
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the characteristics of an epileptic and non-epileptic event (pseudo-seizure).
|Description=None
|Rubric=Positive diagnosis
|Contributors=
|Order=6}}
cf item 105

question.title: What is a key characteristic of an epileptic event?
question.description: Identify the correct characteristic of an epileptic event.

option_a.title: Loss of consciousness for only a few seconds
option_a.description: A brief loss of consciousness, often followed by a return to normal awareness.

option_b.title: Sudden, brief loss of muscle tone
option_b.description: A sudden, brief loss of muscle tone, often accompanied by a post-ictal period.

option_c.title: A prolonged period of confusion and disorientation
option_c.description: A prolonged period of confusion and disorientation, often lasting several minutes or hours.

option_d.title: A sudden, brief loss of muscle tone, followed by a prolonged period of confusion and disorientation
option_d.description: A sudden, brief loss of muscle tone, followed by a prolonged period of confusion and disorientation.
